title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails
message:
Thanks Aprendiz!! i have a mistake, the BRD model is [URL="tel:820-4924"]820-4924[/URL] excuse me!! And PM_SLP_S4 is pulsing, it ranges from normal voltage to zero, and then starts again , all this very quickly.

R6125 R6126 R6127 R6128 OK R6132 R6133 (DIODE MODE READINGS DIFFER FROM 460 ON WORKING BOARD TO 500 ON AFFECTED BOARD)
R6120 R6121 R6122 R6123 OK R6130 R6131 (DIODE MODE READINGS DIFFER FROM 460 ON WORKING BOARD TO 500 ON AFFECTED BOARD)
R6110 R6111 R6112 R6113 R6118 R6119 OK
R6114 R6115 R6116 R6117 OK

U6100

1- [URL="tel:590%202-%20450%203-505"]590 2- 450 3-505[/URL] 4-GND
8- [URL="tel:383%207-%20506%206-460%205-460"]383 7- 506 6-460 5-460[/URL]

PIN 3 AND 7 DIFFER FROM 506 TO 460, LIKE 40


U1900 ( measurements from pin 1 to 16)

WORKING BRD------------>>>>>: [URL="tel:407%20123%20407%20405%20123"]407 123 407 405 123[/URL] 314 GND 410 407 GND GND [URL="tel:403%20290%20380%20380"]403 290 380 380[/URL] GND
PM_SLP_S4_L PULSING BRD: [URL="tel:408%20120%20408%20408%20120"]408 120 408 408 120[/URL] 310 GND 410 410 GND GND [URL="tel:410%20294%20380%20380"]410 294 380 380[/URL] GND

DIODE MODE MEASUREMENTS OK ON U1900

NO CORROSION ON JTAG, neither on SMC.
SMC RESET FORMAL PROCEDURE ( Keyboard One ) NO WORKING, BUT ALTERNATIVE PROCEDURE PRESSING POWER BUTTON FOR 5 SECONDS IS WORKING GOOD, BUT NO CHANGES ON FUNTIONALITY

VOLTAGE ON PPBUS_G3H IS 12.57

Thanks :)

title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails
message:
Is the battery ok? I think these 820-4924 boards need a connected battery to start.

You can disconnect internal keyboard and try external USB if you want to rule out bad kbd.

60w original magsafe charger?

No short on power rails? Witch one is missing starting from S5.

title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails
message: Pulsing power can be anything. Check if CPU power is also pulsing on L7310. These pulses will be very short and usually hard to see on a multimeter.

title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails
message: It would be very unusual for this to happen. Maybe the multimeter is freaking out. Do you have a scope that can capture the pulse? Did you check on pin 2 of L7310? The other side has lots of switching mode garbage on it which may mess with the meter.

title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails

yeah, its pin2 of L7310, dont have a scope :( , i try other multimeter, and it goes to 3.3 to zero, sometimes 3.9 to zero, its worst. I change the Multimeter cables with other new ones, and the same :(

title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails
message: 3.9V on 1.8V rail, this could be a dead CPU, also maybe you are measuring in the unfiltered pin of the coil (pin 1), measure the voltage on R7310.....

title: 820-3476 has PM_SLP_S4_L, and all PP5v Rails
message: If you are 100% sure that there are 4V pulses on CPU Vcore then the CPU has already died. I still very much doubt that your measurement is correct though....
